H0.text: What is another name for ultra-violet light. Violetlight

H1.text: What is another name for ultra-violet light. Ultralux

H2.text: What is another name for ultra-violet light. Actinic Radiation

H3.text: What is another name for ultra-violet light. Blacklite

A4.text: The term actinic rays is used to refer to this phenomenon.

A5.text: Shorter wavelengths are regarded as 'violet' (400nm) and blacklight (365nm).

A6.text: Black lights are used in applications in which extraneous visible light must be minimized; mainly to observe fluorescence, the colored glow that many substances give off when exposed to UV light.

A7.text: Ultraviolet has a higher frequency (thus a shorter wavelength) than violet light.
